events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the highway causing damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report stating a car was involved in a collision.
An agent was assigned promptly to handle the investigation and communication for the customer's vehicle collision claim.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the customer that the case is under review.
Requested photos of the damaged vehicle and police collision report from the customer to proceed with further assessment.
Customer submitted the requested photos and official police report documenting the accident on the specified date.
The claim investigation began, focusing on damage assessment and verifying circumstances around the collision event.
Investigation concluded confirming the extent of vehicle damage aligns with reported accident and no discrepancies found.
A settlement amount was proposed based on repair estimates and policy coverage limits for the collision damage.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and timely communication regarding the auto accident claim.
The claim was approved following customer agreement on the settlement offer and verification that all documentation is complete.
Payment corresponding to the approved settlement for vehicle repairs was issued to the customer promptly.
The auto accident claim file was officially closed after successful payment and customer confirmation of claim resolution.
The claim documents and case files were archived in compliance with company policy and record-keeping standards.
